refnamediv.refpurpose: authenticate users based on their fingerprint

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: &dhproduct; is a PAM module that can authenticate users by their fingerprints. If the given fingerprint scan matches one of the previously stored fingerprints data (.bir format) for a user, the username is stored in the PAM stack and the module returns PAM_SUCCESS. The module requests swiping finger and/or typing in the password at the same time. The user can get authenticated using either of these methods. If a password is typed, the module stores the password in the PAM stack and returns PAM_IGNORE, so that the password can be checked by subsequent modules on the stack.
Depending on the environment while authentication is requested and the service to be authenticated, &dhproduct; requests password and finger-swipe through a GUI widget or a console prompt.
If no fingerprint scanner device is connected to the system or no fingerprint data was found for the user to be authenticated, &dhproduct; returns PAM_AUTHINFO_UNAVAIL.

listitem.para: Send debugging information to syslog, using the auth facility. Depending on system settings the output may end up in /var/log/auth.log, /var/log/messages or /var/log/syslog.

If &dhproduct; is called more than once in a PAM stack and the given user was identified/authenticated by his/her fingerprint in a previous call already, the module returns PAM_SUCCESS immediately without requesting a password or finger-swipe again.
